subject: Re: [junit] Re: Methods that does not return value
msgSnippet: Throwing a class not found exception, catching it, and then returning false is correct behavior for the method inVAJava().  The class isn t found because you
messageBody:
Throwing a class not found exception, catching it, and
then returning false is correct behavior for the
method inVAJava(). The class isn't found because you
aren't running inside of VAJ.

You still haven't answered why you *want* inVAJava()
to return true when you aren't inside the VAJ
environment. Once we know that, then perhaps we can
get closer to addressing your issue.

Rick

--- ok_lilya <lilya.jangirov@...> wrote:
> Rick,
>
> I tried leaving out com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport
> from classpath but
> then what happens, it throws a class not found
> exception and still
> doesn't return true.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Lily.
